glsa.title: MaraDNS: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: A hash collision vulnerability in MaraDNS allows remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: MaraDNS is a proxy DNS server with permanent caching.

description.p: MaraDNS does not properly randomize hash functions to protect against hash collision attacks.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send many specially crafted DNS recursive queries, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All MaraDNS users should upgrade to the latest version:
